article.headline: Albany, N.Y. 64, Cent. Connecticut St. 63
article.story: ALBANY, N.Y. -- Tim Ambrose scored 21 points and the go-ahead basket with 8 seconds left to lead Albany (N.Y.) to a 64-63 victory over Central Connecticut State on Saturday night. The score was tied at 60 when Ambrose hit a jumper to give the Great Danes (5-6) a 62-60 lead. Ralph Watts added two free throws for Albany and Shemik Thompson's 3-pointer with 2 seconds left wasn't enough for Central Connecticut State (4-5). The Blue Devils trailed by 18 points in the final half and cut the lead to 54-38 before going on a 22-3 run to take a 60-57 lead on Ken Horton's jumper with 2:18 remaining. Albany scored the next seven points and Central Connecticut State didn't score again until Thompson's 3-pointer. Mike Black added 15 points and Luke Devlin had 11 rebounds for Albany. Robby Ptacek matched his career-high with 26 points and Horton finished with 15 points for the Blue Devils.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
